result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Ferrell

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Defense.

9:29 AM Defendant David A Ferrell in court.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for David A Ferrell.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense requests another status, needs to obtain discovery and review, requests to be heard on bond.
BTC: Defense to file bond motion.
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program
by DA to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence.

Charges per attached AMENDED criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all.
NG plea entered.

9:16 AM Defendant David A Ferrell in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for David A Ferrell.  Prosecuting attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense requests Bond to be Modified from $20,000 to $500 Cash bond.
State does not object to a bond reduction.
BTC: Bond modified $1,000 Cash bond. Same conditions: No alc, Dndaa
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense.
Letter from defendant re: Bond reduction

10:37 AM Defendant David A Ferrell in court.  Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  SPD has not appointed counsel.  Defense requests adjournment.  State files an amended complaint.  State provides a copy to the deft.  State reads additional counts.  Ng plea entered. 
BTC: Matter adjourned. Finding of good cause to waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.

1:58 PM Defendant David A Ferrell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for David A Ferrell.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
